content:
The equational_theories.Generated.EquationSearch.theorems.RunX scripts seem to be very computationally expensive.

Do we really need to include them in the build file equational_theories.lean?

I can take a look right now at why they're slow. Also, an item on my TODO list has been simply to pare back all of the theorems no longer in the transitive reduction (currently that would remove 20k/30k theorems) so that may also address this.
equational#441 speeds up my local build of EquationSearch theorems by ~4-5x
There's further optimization I think I could do if it is a noticeable drag on your workflow, I just did the simplest thing with the biggest seeming impact first

The action didn't timeout, but it still took 53 minutes to run the project. Is this expected?

I'm inclined to merge both PRs by @Anand Rao Tadipatri (equational#427 and equational#429) because they look fine to me (even if the branch of equational#429 seem to have been created from the branch of equational#427 which isn't considered best practice), but I may be missing something.
Ok, the cache mechanism worked properly and now it took just a few minutes. I'll merge it soon.
Pietro Monticone has marked this topic as resolved.
